intro: Eleocharis maculosa var. genuina, commonly known as the speckled spike-rush, is a flowering plant native to wetland environments in North America. It is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. The plant typically grows in shallow water or moist soil, often forming dense stands in marshes and along the edges of ponds. Its rhizomes help it spread vegetatively, contributing to its ability to colonize wetland habitats. The speckled spike-rush plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and food for various wetland organisms.
